column4: root can play sound, but I cannot.  Is some process stealing my sound device?
What error do you get?
None, just no sound.
play /usr/share/sounds/alsa/*
... and tell us what errors you get.
Indeed; no sound.  But if I put sudo in front, plenty of sound.
... or paste it if it's more than one line.
did you issue the above command as normal user?  If so, what error did you get?
pastebinit
I use aplay.  http://paste.ubuntu.com/1321234/
Looks like it played without error.  Run alsamixer and see if anything is turned down or muted.
There isn't.  But since it works with root, can I not already confirm that?
Users don't have different sound channel levels in my experience, at least not in alsamixer.
play /usr/share/sounds/alsa/Front_Center.wav 2>&1 |pastebinit  #And send resulting URL
Or:  play /usr/share/sounds/alsa/* 2>&1 |pastebinit  #And send resulting URL
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1321272/http://paste.ubuntu.com/1321272/
As you can see, it is playing.  Did you run alsamixer?
Yes.
It is playing, you are just not hearing anything from the speakers.  I dont' know why but that is what is happening.
o_O wtf.  Alsa required side to be unmuted.
Look at alsamixer window and see that nothing is muted or turned down. (MM at bottom of a channel means it is mutted and m toggles mute on or off).
Well, at least, now it is working.  Thanks for the help anyway.  I just did not think I needed side or surround as I haven't needed those in the past.
move from one channel to another with the right or left arrows.  m  will toggle muting on or off.
When you have no sound, first check to see if it is just muted or turned down.  [For future reference.]
